snippet: Experts said that even if passengers aboard the capsized South Korean ferry found air pockets, time was short and the risk of hypothermia was high.
abstract: Experts say that survival of passengers still possibly on board the capsized ferry in South Korea depends on whether there are air pockets inside the boat and the number of people in them.
lead_paragraph: Experts said that even if passengers aboard the capsized South Korean ferry found air pockets, time was short and the risk of hypothermia was high.

headline.main: Time Is Short for High-Risk Rescue Effort
headline.print_headline: Air Pockets May Not Provide Much Help, Experts Say
